image.altText: A sign with a photo of Premier Jacinta Allan with the word banned in a window.

props.synopsis: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

title.children: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians take on Allan government

image.altText: A teenage girl wearing a green hoodie sits on a tree stump in a forest breaking a stick.

props.synopsis: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.Â

title.children: When speaking doesn't come easily the consequences can be life altering

image.altText: G8 graphic

props.synopsis: Despite G8 knowing about problems, an ABC investigation can reveal how the childcare giant downplayed concerns and maintained it had conducted checks.

title.children: 'Smoke and mirrors' and a letter from Lambo guy: An unorthodox childcare deal

image.altText: A sign that says Porepunkah ski hire under a light in a dark street

props.synopsis: As a police operation to find alleged gunman Dezi Freeman continues with no end in sight, Porepunkah residents share their anxiety about being left in limbo.

title.children: As an intense Victorian manhunt continues, locals are feeling the pain

image.altText: Woman with brown hair and fringe holds croissant on a pillow her hands in peace sign

props.synopsis: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

title.children: Kate Reid was in 'anorexic prison' when she created a world-famous croissant

image.altText: Carlton players celebrate during a match against Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: Inaugural Carlton player Gab Pound says the club has reached a turning point after not making the finals since the 2020 COVID-interrupted season.

title.children: Inaugural Blue hopes for finals berth after hot start

image.altText: A Muslim woman with brown skin stands dressed in a headscarf infront of a shelf holding her hands

props.synopsis: When Nausheen Hashmi moved to a south-west Victorian farming town, she wondered how the locals would greet her and her children. She need not have worried.

title.children: Meet the migrants who make this small country town flourish

image.altText: Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

title.children: Hospital's children in war event cancelled amid safety fears

image.altText: A young Dau bounces a baskteball on an outside court

props.synopsis: Last weekend, Dau Akueng, 15, and Chol Achiek, 12, were fatally stabbed on their way home from basketball in Melbourne's western suburbs. The pair is being remembered by those who knew them for who they were, not just how they tragically died.Â

title.children: At 15, Dau wanted to be the best. He was ambitious, but playful too

image.altText: An elderly lady on sitting on a walker, having a cup of tea on a verandah

props.synopsis: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

title.children: Dezi Freeman manhunt leaves elderly people without in-home care

image.altText: A rally in Sydney

props.synopsis: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

title.children: Capital cities witness day of protest across political spectrum

image.altText: Logan Morris clenches his fists in celebration as Lions teammates swarm around him

props.synopsis: Brisbane's finals experience has come to the fore in a commanding and comfortable 53-point semifinal win over the Suns at the Gabba.

title.children: Lions ease past Suns to set up prelim final showdown with Magpies

image.altText: A group of Collingwood AFLW players walk back smiling after a goal.

props.synopsis: Collingwood, wooden spooners last season, keep Sydney goalless for more than three quarters at home on Saturday for an upset win, as Port Adelaide beat another unbeaten side in Melbourne.

title.children: Swans' perfect start ends as Magpies stun at home

image.altText: Brad Battin speaks to media at Parliament House in Melbourne. He stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: More than a year out from the next state election, Opposition Leader Brad Battin is making a pitch to Victorians to make them safer. His policy centrepiece is 'Jack's Law', to give police greater powers to randomly search people for weapons.

title.children: Victorian opposition plan to increase powers to search people for weapons

image.altText: A beautifully refurbished church which is now a school's performing arts centre

props.synopsis: St Michael's Grammar School in St Kilda has apologised after a cast list for an upcoming musical was uploaded to an internal website with physical descriptions such as "bogan" and "tall goof" next to students' names.

title.children: Melbourne school apologises for 'unacceptable' student descriptions

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell has been ordered to serve 200 hours of community service after being found guilty of intimidating a police officer.

title.children: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell found guilty of intimidating police officer

image.altText: Two men in suits outside court.

props.synopsis: James Fitzgerald and Alexander Papanastassis are charged with negligent manslaughter over the death of Luke Briggs, who died eight days after his arrest last year.

title.children: Police officers face court over death of Luke Briggs

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: Police allege two men fatally shot a man in Melbourne two days after shooting another dead.

title.children: Two men charged with murder allegedly involved in second fatal shooting

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: A criminology researcher says rewards do work as a way of catching people, even if the success rate appears low.

title.children: Former police say rewards can work as $1m offered in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Wide shot of three turbine floating on top of the water with two boats

props.synopsis: A Victorian wind farm project that promises to power more than a million homes has been put on ice as developers worry the proposal will not meet government timelines.

title.children: Developers press pause on $8b offshore wind project

image.altText: Fans cheer at Albert Park for the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: The Victorian government fails to win enough crossbench support for its bill to extend the Australian Formula One Grand Prix from a seven-day event to 21 days.

title.children: Plan to extend Melbourne F1 GP to three weeks shelved

image.altText: Smiling Pooja sits in front of a beach box painted in the Australian flag, among row of boxes on the beach. Wears tee, tights.

props.synopsis: Nearly two weeks after the "March for Australia" rallies, the Indian Australian community continues to grapple with the political targeting of the diaspora.Â

title.children: Indian Australians urge Jacinta Price to apologise to help community 'heal'

image.altText: Man in a suit seated at a conference

props.synopsis: Stuart Smith has apologised for the comments he made on a WhatsApp group, and says his resignation is in the "best interests of the party".

title.children: Victorian Liberal state secretary resigns over texts mocking women

image.altText: Two plain clothes police officers carrying paper bags.

props.synopsis: Investigators say they've broken up a major drug syndicate operating out of Melbourne's west and north-west, seizing $20 million worth of illegal drugs.Â

title.children: Police seize 38kg of cocaine in Melbourne drug bust

image.altText: A netball photo featuring teams from Ararat and Southern Mallee

props.synopsis: A botched score in a western Victorian netball league final has led to a senior official resigning and a police escort at the rival clubs' football match as tensions between the clubs remain.

title.children: Police escort footy officials from ground after netball result ignites rivalry

image.altText: An image of Michael Pell.

props.synopsis: Former AFL umpire Michael Pell leaked information about confidential Brownlow Medal votes and used another manâs account to place bets on the marquee event, police allege.

title.children: AFL umpire faces court over alleged Brownlow betting scam

image.altText: A man in handcuffs led by police officers.

props.synopsis: Police say 49-year-old Abdul El Houli was behind the importation of millions of dollars worth of illegal tobacco, supplying dozens of tobacco stores.

title.children: Police arrest alleged major player in Victoria's illegal tobacco trade

image.altText: A woman in a high vis vest sprays fluorescent pink on a wombat by the road

props.synopsis: Wildlife Victoria and Hume City Council are among those calling for mandatory wildlife crash reporting in Victoria, after two women die trying to help an injured animal.

title.children: New calls for wildlife crash report laws after women die helping kangaroo

image.altText: About 10 men photographed holding signs protesting their work conditions

props.synopsis: Melbourne-based company Ansell has confirmed it investigated allegations at a Malaysian factory and identified issues that do not meet labour standards.

title.children: Australian glove-maker Ansell accused of exploiting workers

image.altText: A composite image of two boys who were victims of a fatal knife attack

props.synopsis: Community leaders call for justice for 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek, who have been murdered in what investigators say may have been a case of mistaken identity.

title.children: Mourners honour beloved boys killed in violent Melbourne attack

image.altText: A white electric ute in a green paddock with a trailer full of tree waste

props.synopsis: The Ford F150 Lightning is being touted as the first viable EV for farm work, but it comes with a hefty price tag.

title.children: Is this the first electric ute that farmers will want to use?

image.altText: Detective Superintendent Jason Kelly provides an update to media.

props.synopsis: Officers say the announcement of the reward over the weekend triggered a significant amount of information, but there are still no confirmed sightings of the alleged gunman.

title.children: Police combing through 200 tips after posting $1m Dezi Freeman reward

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police admitted they failed to stop an attack on Camp Sovereignty last month because they did not know it was happening. More officers will be deployed in Melbourne this weekend for planned protests.

title.children: Police admit they were caught off guard by Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: The high-rise towers in Melbourne CBD in the distance, with green trees and houses in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The government has released the first batch of maps revealing what a high-density future could look like for Melbourne residents.

title.children: High-rise plans could transform these Melbourne suburbs

image.altText: A closeup of a ready-to-be-harvested medicinal cannabis plant.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 600 reports of "adverse events" for medicinal cannabis in the past three years, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) is yet to investigate the safety of most medicinal cannabis products. It has now launched a review.Â

title.children: Psychiatrists fear medicinal cannabis adverse events are 'tip of the iceberg'
